Migration.Name: Add root elements to component tracking

PO.Data: This field identifies the root component of the BOM tree. For example, if the component is a carburetor on engine, the root component would be the vehicle inwhich the engine is installed. The field is updated automatically and provides a means of locating a particular component.
The Root Component of the component BOM tree.

This field identifies the root component of the BOM tree. For example, if the component is a carburetor on engine, the root component would be the vehicle inwhich the engine is installed. The field is updated automatically and provides a means of locating a particular component.
The Root Component of the component BOM tree.

Data.oldValue: This field identifies the root component of the BOM tree. For example, if the component is a carburetor on engine, the root component would be the vehicle inwhich the engine is installed. The field is updated automatically and provides a means of locating a particular component.

PO.Data: This field identifies the root component of the BOM tree. For example, if the component is a carburetor installed on an engine, the root component would be the vehicle in which the engine is installed. The field is updated automatically and provides a means of locating a particular component.

The locator in inventory where the root component is to be found. This field provides a means to locate an installed component when the root component is stored in inventory. The field is updated automatically as the root component is moved or shipped. Null values indicate the root component is not in inventory and could be in use (for example, as an asset) or shipped out.
The locator of the root component.

The locator in inventory where the root component is to be found. This field provides a means to locate an installed component when the root component is stored in inventory. The field is updated automatically as the root component is moved or shipped. Null values indicate the root component is not in inventory and could be in use (for example, as an asset) or shipped out.
The locator of the root component.
A non-null value indicates that the root component has been shipped and is not in use or inventory. The value is updated automatically when the root component is shipped.
The last outbound shipment of the Root Component.
A non-null value indicates that the root component has been shipped and is not in use or inventory. The value is updated automatically when the root component is shipped.
The last outbound shipment of the Root Component.

Data.oldValue: This field identifies the root component of the BOM tree. For example, if the component is a carburetor installed on an engine, the root component would be the vehicle in which the engine is installed. The field is updated automatically and provides a means of locating a particular component.

PO.Data: This field identifies the root component of the BOM tree. For example, if the component is a carburetor installed on an engine, the root component would be the vehicle in which the engine is installed. The field is updated automatically and provides a means of locating a particular component. A null value indicates the component is not installed and is its own root.

PO.Data: This field identifies the root component of the BOM tree. The field is updated automatically and provides a means of locating a particular component. A null value indicates the component is not installed and is its own root.
The root component is the top level component of the assembly.
The root component is the top level component of the assembly.
The Assembly or root component in which this component is Installed
